newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Kabul calls for UN Security Council meeting.
newsitem.headline: Kabul calls for UN Security Council meeting.

text.p: The Afghan government on Wednesday called for a special meeting of the U.N. Security Council to discuss the Afghan situation as the rebel Taleban militia said it had reached the outskirts of the capital Kabul.

The demand was made in a statement issued by the Afghan Foreign Ministry in Kabul, which accused neighbouring Pakistan of interference in the country's internal affairs, the official Kabul Radio, monitored in Islamabad, said.

The Afghan government accuses Pakistan of helping the Islamic militia, which on Wednesday captured the strategic town of Sarobi east of Kabul and said its forces had reached the eastern outskirts of the capital.
